summary: This is an email chain between attorneys regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses providing notice to a statutory victim under the Crime Victim Rights Act and schedules upcoming court appearances, including an arraignment and a bail appeal oral argument.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney involved in the case, receiving and sending emails regarding scheduling and victim notifications. He is copied on the initial email and sends a follow-up.

persons.name: Michael Danchuk
persons.context: Copied on an email from Jack Scarola regarding a client's attendance at a scheduled conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The emails discuss her upcoming arraignment and bail appeal.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021.

connections.description: Scarola is communicating about court proceedings and scheduling on behalf of a client, implied to be associated with Maxwell's case or a related victim.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA's office is prosecuting Maxwell and is providing notice of proceedings to a statutory victim.

events.title: Arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled by Judge Nathan at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: The Second Circuit scheduled a remote oral argument in connection with Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal for 10 a.m.

keyFacts: A superseding indictment has added a new statutory victim to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecution intends to provide notice of court proceedings to this victim pursuant to the Crime Victim Rights Act.
Two key court dates are scheduled: an in-person arraignment on April 23, 2021, and a remote bail appeal oral argument on April 26, 2021.
The email correspondence is between legal parties, indicating ongoing pre-trial procedural activity.
The document shows the involvement of attorney Jack Scarola, whose firm's disclaimer is attached, in matters related to the Maxwell case.
